channel.title: Data Structures on Vindum
channel.description: Recent content in Data Structures on Vindum

item.title: How can List be faster than native arrays?
item.description: List is an extremely fast immutable list that can be used as an alternative to native JavaScript arrays. Since List is immutable it is made for functional programming. For this use case it is often much faster than native JavaScript arrays and libraries that operate on arrays like Lodash and Ramda. Jeremy Likness recently tweeted about List (thanks a lot). One of the things he mentioned was the claim that List is faster than arrays.
